intro: Croixia leiocarpa, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States, particularly in moist woodlands and stream banks. The plant features showy, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a smooth texture. The plant is characterized by its ability to thrive in partial shade and its preference for well-drained, fertile soils.
